titles.title: Health Care Incentive Act
To provide for a credit for certain health care benefits in determining the minimum wage for employers required to pay a minimum wage at a rate higher than the current Federal rate.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 12/13/2005--Introduced. Health Care Incentive Act - Directs the Secretary of Labor to allow any employer in interstate commerce that is required by federal or state law to pay a minimum wage rate higher than the current federal rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to count the value of creditable health care benefits in determining the required wage.
